CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant bought a house . The GPE subsequently allocated to the applicant the plot of land on which his house stood . In DATE , PERSON , the applicant ’s neighbour , moved the fence separating their respective plots and thus reduced the size of the applicant ’s land .

CARDINAL . The applicant brought court proceedings against PERSON , seeking the removal of all impediments on the part of PERSON to his use of his land . On CARDINAL DATE ORG found in favour of the applicant . No appeal was lodged and the judgment became final . Following a request by ORG , on DATE ORG quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and ordered a full re - hearing . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims .

CARDINAL . NORP In parallel , the applicant requested the municipality to determine the boundary between his land and that of PERSON was carried out on an unknown date in DATE . PERSON challenged the municipality ’s actions in court but her complaint was rejected on DATE by ORG . There was no appeal and the judgment became final .

CARDINAL . The applicant requested the municipality to establish his title to the land . On DATE the municipality did so , determining the area of the land respectively owned by PERSON and the applicant . PERSON challenged that decision in court . Her request was rejected by ORG on DATE . That judgment was upheld by ORG on DATE and ORG on DATE . The judgment thus became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the municipality annulled its own decision of CARDINAL DATE and granted the applicant title to a smaller parcel of land . The applicant challenged the DATE decision in court and sought an order for the removal of all impediments to his use of his land . On DATE ORG annulled the DATE municipality ’s decision . That judgment was upheld by ORG on DATE and ORG on DATE . That judgment was final .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant requested ORG to issue an enforcement warrant , which was apparently refused . He made a number of complaints in this respect to various ORG authorities such as the ORG , ORG , the municipality ( for instance , in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE ) and was informed that during DATE no enforcement warrant in his name had been submitted for execution . On DATE he was informed by ORG that it was not necessary to issue any enforcement warrant since the court in its judgment of DATE had rejected PERSON ’s claims and thus the municipality ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE remained in force .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON ’s representative PERSON lodged a separate appeal against the judgment of DATE . On DATE ORG decided that the appeal by PERSON ’s representative should be examined by ORG , since most of the judges in GPE had already sat in the case . On DATE the ORG dismissed the appeal on grounds of res judicata . There was no appeal and the judgment became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE E. initiated new proceedings asking the court to determine the rights over the land ( both hers and the applicant ’s ) . The applicant argued that there was no need to examine the case since all outstanding issues had been settled by the various municipality and court decisions adopted earlier . On CARDINAL DATE he asked for an expert report to be made concerning the feasibility of using the land in any other manner than that in which it had been allocated by the municipality in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected PERSON ’s claim and found that the land should be divided in accordance with the municipality ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE . That judgment was upheld by ORG on DATE and by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was issued with an enforcement warrant ordering the delimitation of the border between the applicant ’s land and that belonging to E.
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure reads :

“ ( CARDINAL ) ORG actions shall be examined by the first - instance court within a reasonable time . The criteria for determining of the reasonable length of the proceedings include : the complexity of the case , the conduct of the parties to the proceedings , the conduct of the court . The observance of the reasonable time requirement in examining cases shall be ensured by the court . In examining a specific case , the observance of the reasonable time requirement shall be verified by the higher courts when examining the case on the relevant form of appeal . ”
